alert.note: Alert for Adair; Clarke; Dallas; Jasper; Madison; Marion; Marshall; Polk; Story; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 10 at 8:23PM CST until January 10 at 9:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Polk County in central Iowa... Story County in central Iowa... Southern Marshall County in central Iowa... Madison County in south central Iowa... Northwestern Marion County in south central Iowa... Western Jasper County in central Iowa... Clarke County in south central Iowa... Southeastern Dallas County in central Iowa... East central Adair County in southwestern Iowa... Warren County in south central Iowa... * Until 900 PM CST. * At 822 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near State Center to 5 miles northeast of Macksburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 28 and 72, and between mile markers 87 and 113. Interstate 80 between mile markers 106 and 167. Interstate 235 between mile markers 1 and 14. Locations impacted include... Des Moines, Ames, West Des Moines, Ankeny, Urbandale, Marshalltown, Johnston, Clive, Newton, Indianola, Altoona, Waukee, Norwalk, Pleasant Hill, Grimes, Nevada, Winterset, Osceola, Adel, and Windsor Heights. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED

area.areaDesc: Adair; Clarke; Dallas; Jasper; Madison; Marion; Marshall; Polk; Story; Warren
